intro: Silene megalosperma, commonly known as the giant-seeded catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its distinctive feature is the large, fleshy seeds it produces, which are adapted for wind dispersal. Silene megalosperma is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
